intro: Carphobolus opacus, commonly known as the dark sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. The dark sand verbena is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
